item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "The statistics on sanity are that one out of every four people is suffering from a mental illness. Look at your 3 best friends. If they're ok, then it's you." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Bette Midler
item.description: "Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world." -- Bette Midler

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Ever notice how 'What the hell' is always the right answer?" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Life's hard. It's even harder when you're stupid." -- John Wayne

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it." -- Mae West

item.title: Loreldonaghey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett
